thread.title_full: Smoked salmon, fennel and green bean jar salad - Telegraph

author: Xanthe Clay
title: Smoked salmon, fennel and green bean jar salad
text: SERVES 1 INGREDIENTS For the dressing 1 tbsp. olive oil Half a lemon, juice and zest ¼ tsp. salt 1 small head of fennel, finely sliced (a mandoline or spiralizer is ideal for this) For the salad 200g/7oz green beans (steamed, cooled and cut into short lengths) 1 tin of cannellini beans, drained, rinsed and seasoned with salt, pepper and olive oil 110g/4oz hot smoked salmon or trout, flaked, plus a grinding of pepper  lamb’s lettuce, to fill the jar loosely METHOD Strat by making the dressing. Mix the olive oil with the zest and juice of the lemon and the salt. Finely slice the fennel (a mandoline or spiralizer is ideal for this) and then toss with the oil mixture and stir to coat the fennel. To prepare your salad, place the dressing in the bottom of the jar and then layer on top in this order: green beans, cannellini beans, smoked salmon or trout. Top with the lamb's lettuce to fill the jar and seal to keep fresh.
